eu.opends.environment

Class TrafficLightInternalProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • eu.opends.environment.TrafficLightInternalProgram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TrafficLightInternalProgram
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class represents the internal traffic light program. It provides rules to switch traffic lights of a specific intersection. Each intersection requires an individual instance which runs as thread. Before a traffic light will be switched to green, all traffic lights as given in the *-tlr.xml file will be switched to red first. If no rules file available, all other traffic lights will be switched to red. Traffic lights to switch green will be queued in a list (trafficLightsListForGreen) and be processed every 5 seconds.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrafficLightInternalProgram

        public TrafficLightInternalProgram(Simulator sim,
                                   TrafficLightCenter trafficLightCenter,
                                   java.lang.String intersectionID,
                                   java.util.List<TrafficLight> allTrafficLightsList,
                                   java.util.LinkedList<TrafficLightPhase> intersectionPhasesList)
        Creates a new traffic light program and initializes it by setting the intersectionID and filtering the traffic lights of this intersection from the list of all traffic lights.
        Parameters:
        sim - Simulator
        trafficLightCenter - TrafficLightCenter
        intersectionID - ID of the intersection that runs this instance of the traffic light program
        allTrafficLightsList - List of all traffic lights in the model
        intersectionPhasesList - List of all traffic light phases at the given intersection

    • Method Detail

      • filterTrafficLightsOfIntersection

        public java.util.List<TrafficLight> filterTrafficLightsOfIntersection(java.lang.String intersectionID,
                                                                      java.util.List<TrafficLight> allTrafficLightsList)
        Walks through the traffic light list of the model and returns a list of those which match to the given intersectionID.
        Parameters:
        intersectionID - ID of the current intersection
        allTrafficLightsList - List of all traffic lights contained in the model
        Returns:
        Subset of the input list, containing only traffic lights matching to the given intersectionID

      • requestGreen

        public void requestGreen(TrafficLight trafficLight)
        This method adds a traffic light to the queue of traffic lights waiting to turn green, if it is not contained yet.
        Parameters:
        trafficLight - Traffic light to be added to the green-light-queue

      • getRemainingRed

        public int getRemainingRed(TrafficLight trafficLight)
                    throws NeverGreenException,
                           IsGreenException
        Computes the number of seconds that a given traffic light will be in a different state than "green" according to the internal program schedule.
        Note: Red means every non-green state in this context
        Parameters:
        trafficLight - Traffic light to check for remaining red
        Returns:
        Number of steps, the given traffic light will not be green
        Throws:
        NeverGreenException - If given traffic light will never turn to green
        IsGreenException - If given traffic light has already turned to green

      • getRemainingGreen

        public int getRemainingGreen(TrafficLight trafficLight)
                      throws AlwaysGreenException,
                             IsNotGreenException
        Computes the number of seconds that a given traffic light will be green according to the internal program schedule.
        Parameters:
        trafficLight - Traffic light to check for remaining green
        Returns:
        Number of steps, the given traffic light will be green
        Throws:
        AlwaysGreenException - If given traffic light will always be green
        IsNotGreenException - If given traffic light is not green

      • run

        public void run()
        This method contains a loop with the basic rules to switch the traffic lights of a certain intersection. Instructions will only be carried out in TRIGGER, PROGRAMM or BLINKING mode. Each execution of this loop takes at least 1 second.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
